channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: This is the second time I am reporting this please resolve and remove the broken furniture and bags outside numbers 73 and 71, 30th January
item.description:
The problem has been here for a month and I have reported this twice and that in my opinion you are absolutely useless - resolve this
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Digby Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: CCTV for Low Traffic Neighbourhood Enforcement

item.title: Dumped shelving on public land, 30th January
item.description:
These shelving parts have been sitting on the grass outside the shops near 85 Lauriston Road since late November when a couple of shops refurbished. Could they be cleared please.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lauriston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large and Dee pothole outside number 39, 30th January
item.description:
This pothole was marked with white over two weeks ago along with another one outside 51 Broxholm Road. I had already reported a large pothole along the road and one was filled however nothing has been done for all of the other ones?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broxholm Road, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Steer light number 3 not working corner of Digby Crescent N4 2HS, 30th January
item.description:
This is now the second time I am reporting this. The street light number 3 is not working please resolve. Corner of Digby Crescent Brownwood Road
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brownswood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Terrible state of the road at the roundabout, 30th January
item.description:
The road surface is very poor with numerous potholes at the roundabout on Rosendale Road and Park Hall Road. This issue has been there for several years and has never been addressed despite being reported several times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Hall Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 5 Keslake Road, 30th January
item.description:
Builders have abandoned site leaning bins and bollards blocking road and pavement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Keslake Road, London

item.title: Drop Elbit graffiti on HSBC bank, 30th January
item.description:
This is on private land but it’s a closed bank and the graffiti is large, ugly and there’s a lot of it, plus politically controversial. Can we have a look and ensure that HSBC cleans it if we’re not going to?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Burnt Ash Lane, Sundridge, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned, untaxed and without MOT vehicle, 30th January
item.description:
This vehicle was abandoned quite some time ago and is not taxed or MOT’d. This has been reported by others and nothing has been done about removing the vehicle. The vehicle has a smashed nearside cab window and the rear nearside door has been prised ajar.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: At bus stop and around, 30th January
item.description:
Quite a lot of litter at this bus stop and around, including behind it. Please could you ask the guys to give this area a thorough cleaning Much obliged
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: First stretch of Cameron Road from Hayes Road needs resurfacing., 30th January
item.description:
The section of Cameron Road, entering from Hayes Road (from No.1) is starting to form multiple linear cracks in the road up to No.13 Cameron Road. This section of road needs to be resurfaced. Buses come along here adding more stress to the road surface. There are now 3 large potholes from Busstop G and near entrance to Stone Road which are getting worse by the week - again busses going along these are making this worse and this is not good for passengers either.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Stone Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
